physical_appearance: This is a series of six portrait black-and-white photographs. They are all of either one or two individuals. They are all in native dress. The photographs are quite faded. There are no tears or folds seen. There are no inscriptions on the photographs.
sgcool_label_text: "This is part of a series of small carte de visite format portrait photographs by August Sachtler, a German photographer who started photographing in Singapore in the early 1860s. The studio details inscribed on the back of these cartes de visite read ""A. Sachtler in Singapore""
title_text: Series of six carte de visite portraits by August Sachtler Carte de visite portraits by August Sachtler
subject_terms_1: indigenous people ways of life ethnicity folk costume cultural pluralism occupations (livelihoods) portraits
subject_terms_2: Carte de visite photographs Portrait photography Indigenous people Lifestyles Ethnicity Ethnic costume Cultural pluralism Occupations
